1:
Remember, Yahweh, what has happened to us;\q look and see our disgrace.
\q
2:
Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers;\q our houses to foreigners.
\q
3:
We have become orphans, the fatherless,\q and our mothers are like widows.
\q
4:
We must pay silver for the water we drink,\q and we must pay silver to get our own wood.


\q
5:
Those who are coming after us are close behind us;\q we are weary and we can find no rest.
\q
6:
We have given ourselves to Egypt and to Assyria\q to get enough food.
\q
7:
Our fathers sinned, and they are no more,\q and we bear their iniquities.


\q
8:
Slaves rule over us,\q and there is no one to deliver us from their hand.
\q
9:
We get our bread only by risking our lives,\q because of the sword in the wilderness.
\q
10:
Our skin has grown as hot as an oven\q because of the burning heat of hunger.


\q
11:
Women are raped in Zion,\q and virgins in the cities of Judah.
\q
12:
Princes are hung up by their own hands,\q and no honor is shown to the elders.


\q
13:
Young men are forced to grind grain with a millstone,\q and boys stagger under heavy loads of wood.
\q
14:
The elders have left the city gate,\q and the young men have left their music.


\q
15:
The joy of our heart has ceased\q and our dancing has turned into mourning.
\q
16:
The crown has fallen from our head;\q woe to us, for we have sinned!


\q
17:
For this our heart has become sick,\q for these things our eyes grow dim
\q
18:
for Mount Zion lies desolate, with jackals prowling over it.

\q
19:
But you, Yahweh, reign forever,\q and you will sit upon your throne from generation to generation.
\q
20:
Why do you forget us forever?\q Why do you forsake us for so many days?
\q
21:
Restore us to yourself, Yahweh, and we will be restored.\q Renew our days as they were long agoâ€”
\q
22:
unless you have utterly rejected us\q and you are angry with us beyond measure.
\q
